messages.text: The truth is...
Jazz Mohammed is an heiress to the fortune of Ezra Mohammed, the billionaire and venture capitalist.
Think Paris Hilton, but more clothed and with fewer scandals.
Back at the mansion, Jazz is greeted by her longtime nanny and best friend, Kara Niles.
Kara enfolds Jazz in a huge bear hug.
Where have you been?! I’ve been worried sick!
Kara, it doesn’t take much to worry you.
The chauffeur has been here for an hour already!
Slip her an extra twenty – she’ll be fine.
Jazz, the gala is in three days – you’re not giving her much time to finish these alterations.
Another freakin’ gala. Do I have to?
Come on, dear. Slip into the Chanel gown and step up onto the pedestal
So we can get this dress fitted.
So, Jazz, any big travel plans this year?
I think I’m going to backpack through Europe this summer.
That’s a wonderful idea! Stay at the Four Seasons or the Ritz.
Oh yes, she’s been to the Four Seasons – they know Ezra well there.
Actually, I was thinking of staying in hostels.
Oh, Jazzy, darling, you’ve always had such a good sense of humor.
No, I’m serious.
Why would you want to do that?
I think it would be an adventure.
Poodle, you can still have an adventure.
Just have one with room service and a spa.
Are you bringing anyone to the gala with you?
Hell no. Have you seen the men my dad is trying to get me to date?
Yes. Eligible, educated men who come from good families.
You mean arrogant, materialistic jerks who are only interested in my money.
Jazz. That’s harsh.
They’re more interested in my dad’s company than they are in me.
Jazz’s father owns a company called Mohammed Investments.
It’s one of the most successful venture capital firms in the country.
Ezra Mohammed is at headquarters now.
While his daughter, walled up in his mansion, stares dead-eyed into the mirror.
Jack, have you set up more interviews for the week?
Jack is Ezra’s middle-aged right-hand man.
I need resumes on my desk, stat.
Eduardo and I are working on it.
Eduardo is Jack’s nephew and assistant.
Jack, this is important.
Eventually, I’m going to step down.
We need a qualified successor in place.
Of course. We’re working on it.
It has to be someone young and ambitious – like I once was.
I’m not sure you’re allowed to discriminate based on age.
Plus, older candidates will have more experience under their belts.
Older candidates are less hip with the times.
Not always – there may be someone in your inner circle who is a perfect fit for the job.
Doubtful.
Jack’s face darkens.
So get me those resumes.
Ezra exits the conference room.
Jack makes no move to get resumes.
He treats me like an assistant.
It’s horrible – assistants are the lowest of the low.
Get me my water.
No problem.
You would never know that I helped him to build this company.
From the ground up.
But he had what I didn’t have – the money.
Born with a silver spoon in his mouth.
So, since he had the money, he had the power.
But I had the brains.
He would have never built this empire without you.
And now that he’s looking for a successor, he looks right through me.
But I will not be ignored.
What are you doing to do, boss?
Jack grabs Eduardo by the collar.
It’s not what I’m going to do.
It’s what WE’RE going to do.
Get me the file on Milton Holt.
The tech entrepreneur?
Yes – he holds the key to our future.
Ezra has been trying to secure his business for ages.
If we get him as a client, the power will shift.
But he’s a hard sell.
I heard he rarely partners with unknown investors.
That’s why we need to plant someone on the inside.
Jack holds up a notice.
Milton is looking for protégé – someone to mentor.
We will give him the perfect candidate.
And get all the dirt about Milton!
You are a genius!
I know.
We’ll place an intern inside Milton Holt’s company.
We’ll pay him to report back to us everything he learns.
Brilliant!
We’ll use this information to pursue Milton’s business.
We’ll know all his wants.
We’ll have the advantage over every other company.
Yes!
And once we have Milton’s business, we will take control of Mohammed Investments.
But … who are you going to send in?
That’s the tricky part.
It should be someone bright.
But in need. Serious cash need.
My guys in the Pummelins will have a few leads …
The Pummelins, as you may recall, are the same gang that harassed Jazz about her necklace.
And gave Alex the perfect opportunity to be her knight in shining armor.
But Alex doesn’t look much like a knight right now.
He has retreated with Abby to a rundown apartment in Inglewood.
The furnishings consist mainly of milk crates and cardboard boxes.
Alright – naptime.
You didn’t take this many naps when we lived with the foster freaks.
Yeah, that’s because I was scared about what our foster parents would do to me if I closed my eyes!
They were crazy.
I’ll always be grateful that you got us out of there.
What’s going on? I’m always uncomfortable when you’re not being sarcastic.
I have more than one emotional level, you know.
Go take a nap – you’re freaking me out.
Just then,  Alex’s phone rings.
Hello?
Yes, this is Alex.
What? Could you repeat that?
Uh, are you sure you have the right Alex?
Yeah?
I mean yeah!
Okay.
Sure.
Bye.
Who was that?
It was someone with Mohammed Investments.
He wants to meet with me.
About a job.
Maybe he heard that you always have your nose in those encyclopedias.
Back off – those are the only things I have left of my mom’s, you ass.
Maybe you’re the one who needs a nap!
So, are you going to do it?
